Title: PA.I.A – Pilot qualifications – eligibility
Notes: Review 14 CFR 61.103: age, language, endorsements, knowledge and practical tests.

Title: PA.I.A – Student vs. private privileges
Notes: Compare privileges/limitations of student pilot vs private pilot under Part 61.

Title: PA.I.A – Currency vs. proficiency
Notes: Define difference between currency and proficiency, list what keeps you current as PIC.

Title: PA.I.B – Airworthiness certificates
Notes: Memorize location, validity, and conditions of Airworthiness Certificate and Registration.

Title: PA.I.B – Required documents on board
Notes: Review ARROW: Airworthiness, Registration, Radio (if required), Operating limitations, Weight & balance.

Title: PA.I.B – Required inspections
Notes: Review annual, 100-hour, transponder, ELT, and Pitot-static inspection requirements and intervals.

Title: PA.I.C – Weather basics
Notes: Review stability vs instability, lapse rate, front types, fog types.

Title: PA.I.C – Weather products
Notes: Study METAR, TAF, PIREP, Area Forecast, G-AIRMET, SIGMET, Convective SIGMET.

Title: PA.I.C – Weather briefing flow
Notes: Practice full weather briefing flow (outlook, standard, abbreviated) using 1800WXBRIEF / online tools.

Title: PA.I.E – W&B and performance intro
Notes: Work two sample W&B problems and one takeoff/landing distance problem from POH.

Title: PA.I.E – Performance limitations
Notes: Review density altitude, effects on takeoff roll and climb performance.

Title: PA.I.F – Human factors & IMSAFE
Notes: Memorize IMSAFE checklist and hazardous attitudes with antidotes.

Title: PA.I.F – Aeronautical decision making
Notes: Review PAVE, CARE, TEAM, and DECIDE models.

Title: PA.I.G – Airspace classifications
Notes: Draw airspace classes A–G with weather and visibility requirements.

Title: PA.I.G – Special use airspace
Notes: Review prohibited, restricted, warning, MOA, alert, CFA, TFRs.

Title: PA.I.H – Navigation basics
Notes: Review pilotage, dead reckoning, checkpoints, and course planning.

Title: PA.I.I – Radio communication basics
Notes: Practice standard phraseology for clearance, ground, tower, and CTAF.

Title: PA.I – Oral prep set 1
Notes: Do 30 minutes of rapid-fire Q&A on PA.I topics with your own voice recording.

Title: PA.I – Oral prep set 2
Notes: Review all K-codes in PA.I and mark any weak concepts to revisit.

Title: PA.II.A – Preflight assessment
Notes: Chair-fly full preflight: documents, W&B, fuel, NOTAMs, performance.

Title: PA.II.B – Cockpit management
Notes: Plan checklist order, flow patterns, and document organization in cockpit.

Title: PA.II.C – Engine start & runup logic
Notes: Review reasons behind each step in start and runup checklist.

Title: PA.II.D – Taxi techniques & hot spots
Notes: Review airport diagram, hotspots, and proper taxi speeds and controls.

Title: PA.II – Passenger briefing
Notes: Practice a full passenger briefing including safety, sterile cockpit, and emergency roles.

Title: PA.III – Airport markings & signs
Notes: Review runway markings, taxiway markings, signs, and lighting systems.

Title: PA.III – Runway incursions
Notes: Study hot spots and strategies to prevent runway incursions at KFXE.

Title: PA.IV – Normal T/O and landing
Notes: Chair-fly normal takeoff and landing with all callouts.

Title: PA.IV – Crosswind T/O and landing
Notes: Review crosswind controls, limitations, and go-around criteria.

Title: PA.IV – Short/soft field
Notes: Chair-fly short-field and soft-field takeoff/landing techniques.

Title: PA.V – Ground reference maneuvers
Notes: Review configuration, entry, wind correction, and tolerances for ground ref maneuvers.

Title: PA.VI – Slow flight & stalls
Notes: Chair-fly slow flight, approach-to-landing stall, departure stall with recovery phrase.

Title: PA.VII – Basic instrument maneuvers
Notes: Practice basic scan mentally and note primary vs. supporting instruments.

Title: PA.VIII – Navigation & diversion
Notes: Plan a short cross-country and a mid-flight diversion with times and fuel.

Title: PA.IX – Emergencies overview
Notes: Mentally rehearse engine failure in cruise, after takeoff, and system failures.

Title: PA.X – Night operations
Notes: Review physiology, night illusions, lighting requirements, night currency.

Title: PA.XI – Postflight procedures
Notes: Review postflight inspection, securing aircraft, and discrepancy logging.

Title: ACS Oral – Regs review 1
Notes: Review 61.103, 61.105, 61.107, 61.109 focusing on wording that DPEs love to ask.

Title: ACS Oral – Systems overview
Notes: Summarize in your own words: engine, ignition, fuel, electrical, pitot-static, vacuum, flaps.

Title: ACS Oral – Airspace flash drill
Notes: Do 20 minutes of self-quiz on airspace and cloud clearance.

Title: ACS Oral – Weather flash drill
Notes: Decode 10 METARs and 10 TAFs from random airports.

Title: ACS Oral – Checkride scenario 1
Notes: Write one full XC scenario and walk through planning, departure, diversion, and abnormal events.

Title: ACS Oral – Checkride scenario 2
Notes: Record yourself answering 'Tell me about your airplane' and refine until smooth.

Title: ACS Oral – Final review
Notes: Create a one-page sheet of your weakest topics from ACS and schedule one review block for each.
